name: TheAtlantic
text: Is the press making the same mistakes it made in 2016? Then: When will this pandemic be over? The latest Atlantic Daily, by @mimbsy: https://t.co/arF1zmkyqm

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @YAppelbaum: If you’re waking up this morning to the attorney general’s blistering attack on career civil servants, read @DebPearlstein on how we got here, and how to fix it: https://t.co/gR5lalQQZR

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @prashantrao: South America's largest country has long been ruled by conspiracist thought—and now it's stronger than ever, @Vinncent reports. https://t.co/YIrKekwonC

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @skornhaber: Sufjan Stevens: “No, I don’t want to write another song about my dead mother. I want to write a song that is casting judgment against the world.” https://t.co/MvAu2xcl5A

name: TheAtlantic
text: Do wildfires make COVID-19 worse? We ask an expert on the podcast "Social Distance." https://t.co/GiNVwHDkK4 https://t.co/U2GdRJ2vUC

name: TheAtlantic
text: "A surprisingly effective progressive effort this spring to undermine Trump’s approval ratings on the economy provides a model for how the president’s opponents can hurt Trump where he’s strongest," @GrahamDavidA writes: https://t.co/QvZaXa4Q6Q

name: TheAtlantic
text: Belarus has charged one of its protest leaders with “undermining national security.” The woman, Maria Kolesnikova, is one of three major female opposition figures. Last week, @YasmeenSerhan wrote about the significance of this women-led protest movement: https://t.co/oKwAG8x6z0

name: TheAtlantic
text:
The Atlantic was founded in 1857 to illuminate the American idea. That mission is as urgent today as it was then.

#TheAtlanticFest will examine the magnitude of 2020, who we are as a nation, and what we might become. Tickets are free: https://t.co/btPy6d0N8p

Music: Jon Batiste https://t.co/gvQnyXYRmM

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Unless the next administration also takes on the task of restoring the government’s capacity to harness knowledge and analyze it, even the world’s most devoted public servants will struggle," @DebPearlstein writes: https://t.co/a8k0ZtFpQV

name: TheAtlantic
text: In the coming years, climate change will generate even more destruction—and America's sluggish political system can't possibly keep up, writes @RonBrownstein. https://t.co/wGNqyaifiX

name: TheAtlantic
text:

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @marinakoren: I've wanted to write this story for a long time. There's a better way to talk about space exploration, and it doesn't include "colonizing" Mars: https://t.co/XRLMMBajPN

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @nora_kelly: “We are heading into a new era when we will see records set, and they will fall just as quickly … It’s hard for people to wrap their heads around now, but as bad as things have been this year, unquestionably, they will get worse.” https://t.co/pv6UA9seXq

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @RonBrownstein: The Fire This Time: the irresistible force of accelerating weather disruption from #climatechange is colliding w/the immovable object of unyielding resistance to action from Republican voters & officials alike. My take.  https://t.co/ZwtAz9g3L6

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The president’s imbalanced COVID-19 messaging is another instance of the asymmetric concern that has been a hallmark of his presidency. His passions are deeply misaligned with the duties of his job," @jdickerson writes: https://t.co/xesMeO9Xzj

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Exonerations are like video footage: They are hard evidence, after the fact, that something went wrong between arrest and conviction," @barbarabradleyh writes: https://t.co/Dbz4fQiSlN

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @slaskow: "When leaders draw from that narrative, they don’t inspire the broadest participation in one of America's most impressive projects. They stunt the possibilities of the future instead." Listen to @marinakoren! https://t.co/uBpLOVp8Oe

name: TheAtlantic
text: "American Utopia," "One Night in Miami," "Nomadland," and "MLK/FBI":  Four of the best new films this year collectively feel like an attempt at American soul-searching, @davidlsims writes. https://t.co/Q2Car03XmP
